intro: Adenophora tyosenensis, commonly known as the Korean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers during the summer months. Adenophora tyosenensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
